answers.answer: you have already been told that you were NOT at risk from the "bath tub" experience you had.move on...
Everyone on this site thinks that HIV is so hard to be transmitted.   Why is there so many people being infected?

*sigh*Here we go again.DO your homework.  "SO many" people aren't getting it in the grand scheme of things.  The # of people infected with HIV compared to the total population is actually quite small...especially if you compare it to other serious diseases/conditions which also have no cure...diabetes, certain types of cancer, heck...even the common cold and influenza.....Problem is...people overdramatize what they think about HIV.  Believe what you will.....but it IS true that HIV is NOT a hearty virus, and needs VERY specific conditions to be transmitted.  It is not easy to transmit.  if it WAS as easy to transmit as most of the population thinks (via casual contact, environmental surfaces, kissing, oral sex, protected sex, and on and on)...every other person, or more....would be infected.You had no risk...now you can either choose to dwell on it and torture yourself...or you can believe what we are saying.

question: I have a few questions.  Would diluting hiv viruses in water reduce the amount of risk of being infected?   If so, by how much?   If a drop of vaginal secretion is drop onto the head of my penis, what are the chances for me to get infected?     Please answer my questions, because anxiety is killing me.
title: Anxiety is killing me
